text: Judith Malina (June 4, 1926 â€“ April 10, 2015) was a German-born American theater and movie actress, writer, and director. Malina was born in Kiel and moved to New York City at age three. She co-founded The Living Theatre. She was active during the 1960s and 1970s. She was known for her roles as Sonny's mother in Dog Day Afternoon, Rose in Awakenings and as Paulie Gualtieri's mother in The Sopranos. Malina died of lung disease at her home in Englewood, New Jersey, aged 88. ==References== ==Other websites== *The Living Theatre official site * Category:1926 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Actors from New York City Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:American theatre directors Category:Deaths from lung disease Category:Disease-related deaths in New Jersey Category:German movie actors Category:Movie directors from New York City Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:People from Kiel Category:Writers from New York City Category:German theatre directors
title: Judith Malina
